New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff homer and scored four times in the game.
Mookie Betts had a two-run homer and a two-run double among his four hits.
Max Muncy extended his streak of reaching base safely to 12 plate appearances, a postseason record.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Dodgers routed the New York Mets 10-2, taking a 3-1 lead in the NLCS.
Mookie Betts broke open the game with a two-run double in the fourth inning and a two-run homer in the sixth.
The New York Mets struggled, being outscored 30-9 in the series, including 9-0 in the opener and 8-0 in Game 3.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of continued strong performance.
The Dodgers were one win away from the World Series.
The Mets had a chance to get back in the game but struggled to execute.
Post-Match Reflections: Mookie Betts expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Manager Carlos Mendoza acknowledged the Mets' struggles but emphasized the need for a strong effort in the next game.
Evan Phillips earned the win with 1 1/3 scoreless innings in relief.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers were on the verge of their 25th pennant, the most in NL history.
The Mets' performance was lackluster, leaving the crowd quiet in the late innings.
